item.title: 英国右翼改革党提出全面改革英国央行量化宽松计划
item.description: 英国反叛右翼政党 "改革英国"（Reform UK）希望彻底改革英格兰银行的印钞计划，以节省数十亿英镑用于竞选承诺。【原文：Britain’s insurgent right-wing party Reform UK wants to overhaul the Bank of England’s money printing program to save billions of pounds for manifesto pledges.】

item.title: 德尔加多称莫雷纳党尚未在墨西哥参议院获得超级多数席位
item.description: 执政党领导人周日表示，墨西哥当选总统克劳迪娅-希恩鲍姆领导的联盟在下议院获得了三分之二的席位，在参议院获得了近三分之二的席位。【原文：Mexican President-Elect Claudia Sheinbaum’s coalition obtained two-thirds of the seats in the lower house and nearly two-thirds in the senate, the leader of the ruling party said on Sunday.】

item.title: 特鲁多将于本周就有争议的税制改革进行投票
item.description: 加拿大总理贾斯汀-特鲁多（Justin Trudeau）领导的政府将于本周就提高资本利得税含税率的计划进行投票。【原文：Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s government will call for a vote this week on a planned hike in the capital-gains tax inclusion rate, a measure that would raise billions in additional government revenue and has attracted the ire of the business community.】

item.title: 晋升机会渺茫，入门级员工连起步都难
item.description: 2024 年劳动力市场的一个主要特征是，辞职的人越来越少。另一个鲜为人知的特点是升职的人越来越少。【原文：A main feature of the 2024 labor market is that fewer people are quitting their jobs. A lesser-known one is that fewer are getting promoted.】

item.title: 出口民调显示保加利亚前总理鲍里索夫赢得即席投票
item.description: 保加利亚大权在握的前总理博伊科-鲍里索夫（Boyko Borissov）有望赢得该国三年多来的第六次大选，但将无法获得结束政治僵局所需的多数票。【原文：Bulgaria’s powerful former prime minister Boyko Borissov is on course to win the country’s sixth election in just over three years, but will fall short of a majority needed to end a political deadlock.】

item.title: 欧洲议会选举实时结果
item.description: 柏林欧洲大选期间，一名选民在投票站投票。摄影师：Krisztian Bocsi/Bloomberg【原文：A voter casts his ballot at a polling station during the European Election in Berlin. Photographer: Krisztian Bocsi/Bloomberg】

item.title: 大科技公司正在推动 S&P 反弹。其他公司必须尽快站出来
item.description: 自 2022 年 10 月股市反弹以来，大科技公司的持续增长一直是投资者的信念。【原文：The unceasing growth of Big Tech has been an article of faith for investors since the latest stock market rally began in October 2022.】

item.title: 大选冲击外汇押注，新兴市场交易员涌向地方债务
item.description: 大选冲击粉碎了一些最大新兴经济体的长期押注，新兴市场投资者转而投资当地债券和相对价值货币交易。【原文：Emerging-market investors are turning to local bonds and relative-value currency trades in the aftermath of election shocks that crushed long-standing bets in some of the largest emerging economies.】

item.title: 与 Binance 挂钩的代币创下的纪录巩固了创始人赵明成为美国最富有囚犯的地位
item.description: 与 Binance 及其被监禁的联合创始人赵长鹏有关的加密货币 BNB 代币在赵长鹏被美国判处四个月监禁后的第一周飙升至历史新高。【原文：The BNB token, a cryptocurrency linked to Binance and its incarcerated co-founder Changpeng Zhao, surged to a record high in the first week of his four-month jail sentence in the US.】

item.title: 市场为异常活跃的飓风季节做好准备，巨灾债券销售飙升
item.description: 巨灾债券的发行量刚刚创下历史新高，因为市场正准备迎接可能造成重大损失的恶劣飓风季节。【原文：Issuance of catastrophe bonds just hit a record high, as the market braces for a rough hurricane season with the potential to do substantial damage.】

item.title: 瑞士选民支持增加绿色能源，反对医疗保险上限
item.description: 瑞士选民支持政府促进国内可再生能源发展的计划，这一决定将使阿尔卑斯山太阳能和风能发电厂的建设变得更加容易，并确保持续的补贴。【原文：Swiss voters backed a government plan to boost domestic renewable energy, a decision that will make the construction of solar and wind plants in the Alps easier and ensure continued subsidies.】

item.title: 据《泰晤士报》报道，申银万国可能无资格跻身富时 100 指数
item.description: 据《泰晤士报》报道，Shein 可能没有资格被纳入富时 100 指数，即使这家在线零售商正在为首次公开募股做准备，这可能是英国有史以来规模最大的首次公开募股之一。【原文：Shein may not qualify for inclusion on the FTSE 100 Index even as the online retailer gears up for an initial public offering that could be one of the largest ever in the UK, The Times reported.】

item.title: 马来西亚称将从 6 月 10 日起取消柴油补贴
item.description: 马来西亚第二财政部长阿米尔-哈姆扎-阿兹赞（Amir Hamzah Azizan）表示，马来西亚将从 6 月 10 日起削减一揽子柴油补贴，以履行改善国家财政状况的重要承诺。【原文：Malaysia will cut blanket diesel subsidies beginning June 10, Second Finance Minister Amir Hamzah Azizan said, fulfilling a key pledge to improve the country’s finances.】

item.title: 沃尔沃将电动汽车生产从中国转移到比利时
item.description: 据英国《泰晤士报》报道，由于欧盟准备对中国产电动汽车征收关税，沃尔沃汽车公司已开始将中国产电动汽车的生产转移到比利时。【原文：Volvo Car AB has started to shift manufacturing of Chinese-made electric vehicles to Belgium as the European Union prepares to impose tariffs on China-made EVs, The Times reported.】

item.title: 新西兰将在下半年取消石油和天然气勘探禁令
item.description: 新西兰政府以天然气储量 "迅速 "减少带来的能源安全挑战为由，正在加紧实施取消近海石油勘探禁令的计划。【原文：New Zealand’s government is pressing ahead with plans to lift a ban on offshore petroleum exploration, citing energy security challenges from “rapidly” declining natural gas reserves.】

item.title: 印度的气候困境将笼罩莫迪的未来五年
item.description: 印度总理纳伦德拉-莫迪（Narendra Modi）带着被削弱的授权进入了他的第三个任期，他希望印度在气候外交和清洁技术领域走在前列，迎接一个新的 "绿色时代"。【原文：Prime Minister Narendra Modi, heading into his third term with a weakened mandate, wants India to embrace a new “green era” at the forefront of climate diplomacy and clean technology.】

item.title: 液化天然气价格下滑加速中国卡车 "油改气 "进程
item.description: 天然气价格的暴跌和未来几年供应过剩的前景，刺激了以这种燃料为动力的卡车和轮船的销售，加速了这个最大进口国从石油向天然气的长期转变。【原文：A slump in the price of natural gas and the prospect of a glut in the years ahead is spurring sales of trucks and ships powered by the fuel, hastening a long-term shift away from oil in the top importer.】

item.title: 马里银行工会因领导人被捕延长停工期
item.description: 马里银行工会主席周三被捕后，代表该国银行职员的工会延长了停工期，马里各银行办事处将无限期关闭。【原文：Bank offices in Mali will remain closed indefinitely after a union representing the nation’s bank staff extended a work stoppage following the arrest of its president on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美联储点阵图即将揭示降息决心
item.description: 周三，美国政策制定者将在三个月内首次更新利率预测，届时投资者可能会进一步了解美联储放松货币政策的决心。【原文：Investors may glean more on the Federal Reserve’s resolve to ease monetary policy when US policymakers update their forecasts for interest rates Wednesday for the first time in three months.】

item.title: 坎波斯-内托称巴西必须降低结构性利率
item.description: 巴西央行行长说，有必要认识到，巴西的中性结构利率如此之高有几个原因，其中包括财政政策，重要的是要消除问题的根源。【原文：Brazil’s central bank president said it’s necessary to understand that there are several reasons why the country’s neutral structural interest rate is so high, including fiscal policy, and it’s important to fight the cause of the problems.】

item.title: 银行资产大甩卖是债券市场的福音：信贷周刊
item.description: 银行正在抛售资产，其中许多银行为此转向了债券市场的繁荣领域。【原文：Banks are dumping assets and many of them are turning to a booming sector of the bond market to do so.】

item.title: 巴西糖业大亨称卢拉的财政计划将使利率居高不下
item.description: 巴西糖业巨头科桑公司（Cosan SA）董事长批评总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦（Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva）政府的财政政策，称改革无法减少公共债务，并将使利率居高不下。【原文：The chairman of Brazilian sugar giant Cosan SA criticized the fiscal policy of President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s government, saying the reforms don’t reduce public debt and will keep interest rates high.】

item.title: 拜登与马克龙寻求在紧张局势后共同应对中国贸易问题
item.description: 美国总统乔-拜登和法国总统埃马纽埃尔-马克龙一致认为有必要更好地合作应对中国的经济行为，而这一话题有时会在两国领导人之间引起摩擦。【原文：US President Joe Biden and French President Emmanuel Macron agreed on the need to better cooperate to counter China’s economic practices, a topic that has sometimes caused friction between the two leaders.】

item.title: 纽约州议会针对债务重组搁置者的法案陷入僵局
item.description: 旨在阻止持有债券的投资者利用纽约法院起诉违约外国政府的立法在州议会陷入僵局。【原文：Legislation seeking to block holdout bond investors from using New York courts to sue defaulted foreign governments stalled in the state assembly.】

item.title: 通胀率居高不下，美联储将抑制降息计划
item.description: 在近期通胀数据大幅上升之后，经济学家们对美联储官员将在下周的政策会议上发出 2024 年降息多少次的信号存在分歧。【原文：Economists are divided over how many interest-rate cuts Federal Reserve officials will signal for 2024 at their policy meeting next week, following a pop in recent inflation figures.】

item.title: 欧盟准备征收电动汽车关税，德国警告不要设置贸易壁垒
item.description: 在欧盟即将对从中国进口的电动汽车征收关税之际，德国总理奥拉夫-肖尔茨发表讲话，反对限制汽车贸易。【原文：German Chancellor Olaf Scholz spoke out against restricting automotive trade as the European Union moves closer to slapping tariffs on electric vehicles imported from China.】

item.title: 昂贵的美国食糖关税驱使糖果制造商越境前往加拿大
item.description:
加拿大的糖果生产不断扩大，因为公司希望在避开美国保护主义政策的同时为北美家庭供应糖分。【原文：

Sweets production has expanded in Canada as companies look to supply sugar-hungry North American households while avoiding US protectionist policies.

】

item.title: 据说沙特将把阿美石油公司约 60% 的股份转让给外国基金
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士称，在沙特阿美公司价值 112 亿美元的股票出售中，外国投资者将获配约 60% 的股票，这标志着该石油巨头 2019 年的上市计划出现了转机，该计划最终以本地投资者为主。【原文：Foreign investors are set to be allocated about 60% of the shares on offer in Saudi Aramco’s $11.2 billion stock sale, people familiar with the matter said, marking a turnaround from the oil giant’s 2019 listing that ended up as a largely local affair.】

item.title: 比特币反弹和 "短暂记忆 "重燃加密货币领域的激情
item.description: 比特币反弹至接近历史新高，唤醒了动物精神；不仅是在加密货币市场本身，而且在更广泛的金融界，去年曾将数字资产领域弃之如敝屣。【原文：Bitcoin’s rally to near a record high is reawakening animal spirits — not just in the cryptocurrency market itself, but in the broader financial world that had left the digital asset sector for dead last year.】
